topics.body:
News:
"2014 USA election calculations":http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/upshot/elections-2014-make-your-own-senate-forecast.html?ref=politics&_r=0&abt=0002&abg=0
Tl:dr; chances are after the midterms in the senate either republicans will control the senate by one seat, it'll be completely even or democrats will control the senate by one seat.


Also god damn it;
That person that was found to have Ebola in Texas could have come in contact with up to 80 people in Dallas.  While obviously it's not going to be a large outbreak we're still talking potentially a dozen people infected.  The cdc fortunately already cracked down on it.  I would not be surprised if more and more African country's borders get shut down completely.



Some tech news:
Right now facebook is getting super replaced quickly.  What is happening?  This new site called ello from germany in a month became the 6112th most visited site on the internet; facebook is the second most visited site, but I don't use social media sites personally.  On the one hand ello is totally a sjw site, on the other facebook sells people's personal contact information and is actively against glbt.  It's times like these I'm glad I don't use social media sites.
